text.text_translated: Terrie Sharp, a best‑selling writer, can tell a good story and has won the Olive Crime Writer Award twice. She was born in a neighbourhood in Glasgow that had the highest crime level, so she learned to stay quiet, avoid trouble, and even how to open car doors with a knife. Fortunately, she only used this skill to write her novels. Today, she is no longer quiet. She appears on popular daytime programmes such as Police Today and at writing conferences all over the UK.
